extendedInfo.description: You can subscribe to dozens of magazines by checking out our website http://exacteditions.com, then read them from your phone or tablet through Exactly! We also have a tonne of sample issues ready to read on Exactly right now.Exactly brings magazines and books to Android in their original full-colour format. Each page is delivered just as it appeared in the print edition, but with live links to web sites, phone numbers and more. Access free content from over 100 titles, or use your Exact Editions subscription to read the latest issues on the day they're published.â Sync issues by tapping the sync button next to the issue name.â Swipe pages left and right, or tap the page edges to flip to next/previous page.â Pinch or double tap pages to zoom.â Tap any page links to web sites, email addresses, phone numbers or maps.â Tap contents-page links to jump to a particular article.Here's a list of the permissions we request and why we request them:'View network status' -> We only sync over wi-fi as the files are quite large and we don't want you getting charged for phone data.'Full Internet access' -> We need to access the internet to download issues!'Directly call phone numbers' -> When you tap a phone number in a magazine, the app will ask if you want to go ahead a call it.'Modify/delete SD card contents' ->  Your synced issues are saved on your SD card.Hopefully that's useful!

reviews.title: Works
reviews.comment: Make sure to set up an account first at the Exact Editions site to subscribe to your favourite magazine, which you can then view using this app (look for it under Titles). To Sync ensure you have wifi.
reviews.author: Alissa Kleist

reviews.title: Disappointingly backward
reviews.comment: An ugly interface for browsing the publications, it completely ignores modern Android UI guidelines.  Zooming and scrolling within a publication is jerky and slow. Swiping to the next page works, but provides no visual feedback of the page transition - it\'s a small complaint, but a slide or page-turn animation would help the user feel some continuity.  Lastly, and probably worst of all, text is stored as a relatively low-resolution bitmap. Zoom in and everything is an ugly blur - zoom out and some words are clear while others are blurry as poor-quality image-scaling takes its toll.
reviews.author: Edward Coffey

reviews.title: Really don\'t understand how it\'s supposed to work
reviews.comment: I like to think I\'m no dunce when it comes to these things, but the app opens on a publication I don\'t recall buying, and there seems to be no way to access any menu that I can see to navigate anywhere else. Can anyone help? UI seems to work terribly on Galaxy Tab 2 10.1
reviews.author: Nick Drew

reviews.title: Horrible UI
reviews.comment: This application badly needs a redesign. As far as I can tell, there is no way to log in, subscribe to magazines, or even purchase them. It could just be I haven\'t yet figured out how to do so, but these should be basic, discoverable functionalities.
reviews.author: S\303\251rgio Gomes

reviews.title: Works OK
reviews.comment: App could really do with a makeover and performance boost. However it does the job.
reviews.author: Richard Gordon

reviews.title: Frustrating - But works
reviews.comment: You can\'t easily find your subscriptions.. I have a list of some 100 magazines that I need to scroll through, until you turn off \'sample issues\', then it\'s ok.. But it takes ages to cache locally and appears to stop downloading when you start reading.   When it\'s all downloaded.. It\'s actually quite good to use! And I love having the back issues, just wish it would remember where I got to in each issue.
reviews.author: Scott Rixon

reviews.comment: How do you get to the homepage? App opens on one publucation and won\'t leave it. Hopeless.
reviews.author: Alan Metchem

reviews.title: Looks ace
reviews.comment: Can be a bit fiddly to switch between publications but final product is amazing.
reviews.author: Andrew Cartwright

reviews.title: Smooth and easy to use
reviews.comment: Subscriptions load fast and pages turn with ease! Great app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: New releases vastly improved on Nexus 7
reviews.comment: On my Nexus 7 the latest releases are a vast improvement. (1) Turing pages using page swipe now works consistently. (2) Offline mode now works without demanding to connect to the Internet .. that is kinda hard in most aeroplanes. (3) The new Pages function to quickly scan page thumbnails has added a desperately needed way to easily navigate publications. Overall, much much better than previous releases .. at least on a Nexus 7.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Rather unfortunate
reviews.comment: Sadly a tad unresponsive/sluggish. Hopefully it\'ll get better/as good as the iOS version in time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment: On my Samsung Galaxy III our magazine looks fabulous. Having worked closely with Opera readers all over the world and passing on their queries to Exactly , I am very happy with this app. Well done.
reviews.author: Megan Jackson

reviews.title: Crashes at the first touch
reviews.comment: I\'m trying to use it to read \"Le monde diplomatique\". It just crashes directly when I try to zoom or turn a page. Disastrous app!
reviews.author: Julien Marcer

reviews.title: Too bad
reviews.comment: There is force close problem.you cannot even read the 1st page
reviews.author: Mustafa T

reviews.title: Fixed
reviews.comment: Seems to be working now.The sync function is good,will see how well it works. Still not as slick as others,but getting better. A two page view in landscape mode would be a useful addition.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes constantly
reviews.comment: It can\'t even turn one page without crashing.
reviews.author: Benjamin Geer

reviews.title: MASSIVELY improved...
reviews.comment: ...from its initial incarnation, which was a poorly-thought-out disaster. Now does everything it should, as far as I can see. Index links work in offline mode; doesn\'t ask you to connect to internet when you\'re offline (as long as you\'ve synched some issues). Caveat: takes a long time to download issues if you\'ve got a few subscriptions, so only do this over wi-fi.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sweet
reviews.comment: Like nuts in chocolate. Like WSC in sponge.
reviews.author: Ian Goodwin

reviews.title: Crashes all the time
reviews.comment: Worst app ever. It takes hours to sync magazines and turning pages when synced take a lot of time. At this moment I can not even open my magazines anymore, as the app keeps crashing. Clear data and reinstall does not solve the problem.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Latest update a disaster! Now I can\'t get anything at all, just crashes! Utterly useless & subscriptions were a waste of money!\tIt was never a particularly good app on either my Galaxy 2 phone or my tablet but latest update has knocked out all my previously synced issues & it has taken all day to sync 2 issues and is now stuck at the same % download level. I have 2 subscriptions & might just manage to sync them all before the year\'s subscription is out. Won\'t be buying any more , will stick to Zinio in future! Very poor show.
reviews.author: A Google User
